description: Updates a specified application. An application has to be in a stopped or created state in order to be updated.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the application to update.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: The client idempotency token of the application to update. Its value must be unique for each request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: initialCapacity
parameters.description: The capacity to initialize when the application is updated. (string) --- Worker type for an analytics framework. (dict) --- The initial capacity configuration per worker. The number of workers in the initial capacity configuration. workerConfiguration (dict) --- The resource configuration of the initial capacity configuration. The CPU requirements for every worker instance of the worker type. The memory requirements for every worker instance of the worker type. disk (string) --- The disk requirements for every worker instance of the worker type. diskType (string) --- The disk type for every worker instance of the work type. Shuffle optimized disks have higher performance characteristics and are better for shuffle heavy workloads. Default is STANDARD.

nested_params.name: workerCount
nested_params.description: The number of workers in the initial capacity configuration.

nested_params.name: workerConfiguration
nested_params.description: The resource configuration of the initial capacity configuration.

nested_params.name: cpu
nested_params.description: The CPU requirements for every worker instance of the worker type.

nested_params.name: memory
nested_params.description: The memory requirements for every worker instance of the worker type.

nested_params.name: disk
nested_params.description: The disk requirements for every worker instance of the worker type.

nested_params.name: diskType
nested_params.description: The disk type for every worker instance of the work type. Shuffle optimized disks have higher performance characteristics and are better for shuffle heavy workloads. Default is STANDARD.

parameters.name: maximumCapacity
parameters.description: The maximum capacity to allocate when the application is updated. This is cumulative across all workers at any given point in time during the lifespan of the application. No new resources will be created once any one of the defined limits is hit. The maximum allowed CPU for an application. The maximum allowed resources for an application. disk (string) --- The maximum allowed disk for an application.

nested_params.name: cpu
nested_params.description: The maximum allowed CPU for an application.

nested_params.name: memory
nested_params.description: The maximum allowed resources for an application.

nested_params.name: disk
nested_params.description: The maximum allowed disk for an application.

parameters.name: autoStartConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration for an application to automatically start on job submission. enabled (boolean) --- Enables the application to automatically start on job submission. Defaults to true.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Enables the application to automatically start on job submission. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: autoStopConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration for an application to automatically stop after a certain amount of time being idle. enabled (boolean) --- Enables the application to automatically stop after a certain amount of time being idle. Defaults to true. idleTimeoutMinutes (integer) --- The amount of idle time in minutes after which your application will automatically stop. Defaults to 15 minutes.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Enables the application to automatically stop after a certain amount of time being idle. Defaults to true.

nested_params.name: idleTimeoutMinutes
nested_params.description: The amount of idle time in minutes after which your application will automatically stop. Defaults to 15 minutes.

parameters.name: networkConfiguration
parameters.description: The network configuration for customer VPC connectivity. subnetIds (list) --- The array of subnet Ids for customer VPC connectivity. (string) --- securityGroupIds (list) --- The array of security group Ids for customer VPC connectivity. (string) ---

nested_params.name: subnetIds
nested_params.description: The array of subnet Ids for customer VPC connectivity.

nested_params.name: securityGroupIds
nested_params.description: The array of security group Ids for customer VPC connectivity.

parameters.name: imageConfiguration
parameters.description: The image configuration to be used for all worker types. You can either set this parameter or imageConfiguration for each worker type in WorkerTypeSpecificationInput. imageUri (string) --- The URI of an image in the Amazon ECR registry. This field is required when you create a new application. If you leave this field blank in an update, Amazon EMR will remove the image configuration.

nested_params.name: imageUri
nested_params.description: The URI of an image in the Amazon ECR registry. This field is required when you create a new application. If you leave this field blank in an update, Amazon EMR will remove the image configuration.

parameters.name: workerTypeSpecifications
parameters.description: The key-value pairs that specify worker type to WorkerTypeSpecificationInput. This parameter must contain all valid worker types for a Spark or Hive application. Valid worker types include Driver and Executor for Spark applications and HiveDriver and TezTask for Hive applications. You can either set image details in this parameter for each worker type, or in imageConfiguration for all worker types. (string) --- Worker type for an analytics framework. (dict) --- The specifications for a worker type. imageConfiguration (dict) --- The image configuration for a worker type. imageUri (string) --- The URI of an image in the Amazon ECR registry. This field is required when you create a new application. If you leave this field blank in an update, Amazon EMR will remove the image configuration.

nested_params.name: imageConfiguration
nested_params.description: The image configuration for a worker type.

nested_params.name: imageUri
nested_params.description: The URI of an image in the Amazon ECR registry. This field is required when you create a new application. If you leave this field blank in an update, Amazon EMR will remove the image configuration.

parameters.name: interactiveConfiguration
parameters.description: The interactive configuration object that contains new interactive use cases when the application is updated. studioEnabled (boolean) --- Enables you to connect an application to Amazon EMR Studio to run interactive workloads in a notebook. livyEndpointEnabled (boolean) --- Enables an Apache Livy endpoint that you can connect to and run interactive jobs.

nested_params.name: studioEnabled
nested_params.description: Enables you to connect an application to Amazon EMR Studio to run interactive workloads in a notebook.

nested_params.name: livyEndpointEnabled
nested_params.description: Enables an Apache Livy endpoint that you can connect to and run interactive jobs.

parameters.name: runtimeConfiguration
parameters.description: The Configuration specifications to use when updating an application. Each configuration consists of a classification and properties. This configuration is applied across all the job runs submitted under the application. (dict) --- A configuration specification to be used when provisioning an application. A configuration consists of a classification, properties, and optional nested configurations. A classification refers to an application-specific configuration file. Properties are the settings you want to change in that file. The classification within a configuration. properties (dict) --- A set of properties specified within a configuration classification. (string) --- (string) --- configurations (list) --- A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_params.name: classification
nested_params.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_params.name: properties
nested_params.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.

nested_params.name: configurations
nested_params.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

parameters.name: monitoringConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration setting for monitoring. s3MonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The Amazon S3 configuration for monitoring log publishing. logUri (string) --- The Amazon S3 destination URI for log publishing. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs published to the given Amazon S3 destination. managedPersistenceMonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The managed log persistence configuration for a job run. enabled (boolean) --- Enables managed logging and defaults to true. If set to false, managed logging will be turned off. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs stored in managed log persistence. cloudWatchLoggingConfiguration (dict) --- The Amazon CloudWatch configuration for monitoring logs. You can configure your jobs to send log information to CloudWatch. Enables CloudWatch logging. logGroupName (string) --- The name of the log group in Amazon CloudWatch Logs where you want to publish your logs. logStreamNamePrefix (string) --- Prefix for the CloudWatch log stream name. encryptionKeyArn (string) --- The Key Management Service (KMS) key ARN to encrypt the logs that you store in CloudWatch Logs. logTypes (dict) --- The types of logs that you want to publish to CloudWatch. If you don't specify any log types, driver STDOUT and STDERR logs will be published to CloudWatch Logs by default. For more information including the supported worker types for Hive and Spark, see Logging for EMR Serverless with CloudWatch. Key Valid Values: SPARK_DRIVER, SPARK_EXECUTOR, HIVE_DRIVER, TEZ_TASK Array Members Valid Values: STDOUT, STDERR, HIVE_LOG, TEZ_AM, SYSTEM_LOGS (string) --- Worker type for an analytics framework. (list) --- (string) --- Log type for a Spark/Hive job-run. prometheusMonitoringConfiguration (dict) --- The monitoring configuration object you can configure to send metrics to Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus for a job run. remoteWriteUrl (string) --- The remote write URL in the Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus workspace to send metrics to.

nested_params.name: s3MonitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 configuration for monitoring log publishing.

nested_params.name: logUri
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 destination URI for log publishing.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs published to the given Amazon S3 destination.

nested_params.name: managedPersistenceMonitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: The managed log persistence configuration for a job run.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Enables managed logging and defaults to true. If set to false, managed logging will be turned off.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs stored in managed log persistence.

nested_params.name: cloudWatchLoggingConfiguration
nested_params.description: The Amazon CloudWatch configuration for monitoring logs. You can configure your jobs to send log information to CloudWatch.

nested_params.name: enabled
nested_params.description: Enables CloudWatch logging.

nested_params.name: logGroupName
nested_params.description: The name of the log group in Amazon CloudWatch Logs where you want to publish your logs.

nested_params.name: logStreamNamePrefix
nested_params.description: Prefix for the CloudWatch log stream name.

nested_params.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_params.description: The Key Management Service (KMS) key ARN to encrypt the logs that you store in CloudWatch Logs.

nested_params.name: logTypes
nested_params.description: The types of logs that you want to publish to CloudWatch. If you don't specify any log types, driver STDOUT and STDERR logs will be published to CloudWatch Logs by default. For more information including the supported worker types for Hive and Spark, see Logging for EMR Serverless with CloudWatch.

nested_params.name: prometheusMonitoringConfiguration
nested_params.description: The monitoring configuration object you can configure to send metrics to Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus for a job run.

nested_params.name: remoteWriteUrl
nested_params.description: The remote write URL in the Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus workspace to send metrics to.

parameters.name: schedulerConfiguration
parameters.description: The scheduler configuration for batch and streaming jobs running on this application. Supported with release labels emr-7.0.0 and above. queueTimeoutMinutes (integer) --- The maximum duration in minutes for the job in QUEUED state. If scheduler configuration is enabled on your application, the default value is 360 minutes (6 hours). The valid range is from 15 to 720. maxConcurrentRuns (integer) --- The maximum concurrent job runs on this application. If scheduler configuration is enabled on your application, the default value is 15. The valid range is 1 to 1000.

nested_params.name: queueTimeoutMinutes
nested_params.description: The maximum duration in minutes for the job in QUEUED state. If scheduler configuration is enabled on your application, the default value is 360 minutes (6 hours). The valid range is from 15 to 720.

nested_params.name: maxConcurrentRuns
nested_params.description: The maximum concurrent job runs on this application. If scheduler configuration is enabled on your application, the default value is 15. The valid range is 1 to 1000.

nested_items.name: application
nested_items.description: Information about the updated application.

nested_items.name: applicationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the application.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the application.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the application.

nested_items.name: releaseLabel
nested_items.description: The Amazon EMR release associated with the application.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of application, such as Spark or Hive.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The state of the application.

nested_items.name: stateDetails
nested_items.description: The state details of the application.

nested_items.name: initialCapacity
nested_items.description: The initial capacity of the application.

nested_items.name: workerCount
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: workerCount
nested_items.description: The number of workers in the initial capacity configuration.

nested_items.name: workerConfiguration
nested_items.description: The resource configuration of the initial capacity configuration.

nested_items.name: cpu
nested_items.description: The CPU requirements for every worker instance of the worker type.

nested_items.name: memory
nested_items.description: The memory requirements for every worker instance of the worker type.

nested_items.name: disk
nested_items.description: The disk requirements for every worker instance of the worker type.

nested_items.name: diskType
nested_items.description: The disk type for every worker instance of the work type. Shuffle optimized disks have higher performance characteristics and are better for shuffle heavy workloads. Default is STANDARD.

nested_items.name: maximumCapacity
nested_items.description: The maximum capacity of the application. This is cumulative across all workers at any given point in time during the lifespan of the application is created. No new resources will be created once any one of the defined limits is hit.

nested_items.name: cpu
nested_items.description: The maximum allowed CPU for an application.

nested_items.name: memory
nested_items.description: The maximum allowed resources for an application.

nested_items.name: disk
nested_items.description: The maximum allowed disk for an application.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when the application run was created.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time when the application run was last updated.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: autoStartConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration for an application to automatically start on job submission.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Enables the application to automatically start on job submission. Defaults to true.

nested_items.name: autoStopConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration for an application to automatically stop after a certain amount of time being idle.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Enables the application to automatically stop after a certain amount of time being idle. Defaults to true.

nested_items.name: idleTimeoutMinutes
nested_items.description: The amount of idle time in minutes after which your application will automatically stop. Defaults to 15 minutes.

nested_items.name: networkConfiguration
nested_items.description: The network configuration for customer VPC connectivity for the application.

nested_items.name: subnetIds
nested_items.description: The array of subnet Ids for customer VPC connectivity.

nested_items.name: securityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The array of security group Ids for customer VPC connectivity.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: architecture
nested_items.description: The CPU architecture of an application.

nested_items.name: imageConfiguration
nested_items.description: The image configuration applied to all worker types.

nested_items.name: imageUri
nested_items.description: The image URI.

nested_items.name: resolvedImageDigest
nested_items.description: The SHA256 digest of the image URI. This indicates which specific image the application is configured for. The image digest doesn't exist until an application has started.

nested_items.name: workerTypeSpecifications
nested_items.description: The specification applied to each worker type.

nested_items.name: imageConfiguration
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: imageConfiguration
nested_items.description: The image configuration for a worker type.

nested_items.name: imageUri
nested_items.description: The image URI.

nested_items.name: resolvedImageDigest
nested_items.description: The SHA256 digest of the image URI. This indicates which specific image the application is configured for. The image digest doesn't exist until an application has started.

nested_items.name: runtimeConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Configuration specifications of an application. Each configuration consists of a classification and properties. You use this parameter when creating or updating an application. To see the runtimeConfiguration object of an application, run the GetApplication API operation.

nested_items.name: classification
nested_items.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_items.name: properties
nested_items.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_items.description: The configuration setting for monitoring.

nested_items.name: s3MonitoringConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 configuration for monitoring log publishing.

nested_items.name: logUri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 destination URI for log publishing.

nested_items.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_items.description: The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs published to the given Amazon S3 destination.

nested_items.name: managedPersistenceMonitoringConfiguration
nested_items.description: The managed log persistence configuration for a job run.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Enables managed logging and defaults to true. If set to false, managed logging will be turned off.

nested_items.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_items.description: The KMS key ARN to encrypt the logs stored in managed log persistence.

nested_items.name: cloudWatchLoggingConfiguration
nested_items.description: The Amazon CloudWatch configuration for monitoring logs. You can configure your jobs to send log information to CloudWatch.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Enables CloudWatch logging.

nested_items.name: logGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the log group in Amazon CloudWatch Logs where you want to publish your logs.

nested_items.name: logStreamNamePrefix
nested_items.description: Prefix for the CloudWatch log stream name.

nested_items.name: encryptionKeyArn
nested_items.description: The Key Management Service (KMS) key ARN to encrypt the logs that you store in CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: prometheusMonitoringConfiguration
nested_items.description: The monitoring configuration object you can configure to send metrics to Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus for a job run.

nested_items.name: remoteWriteUrl
nested_items.description: The remote write URL in the Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus workspace to send metrics to.

nested_items.name: interactiveConfiguration
nested_items.description: The interactive configuration object that enables the interactive use cases for an application.

nested_items.name: studioEnabled
nested_items.description: Enables you to connect an application to Amazon EMR Studio to run interactive workloads in a notebook.

nested_items.name: livyEndpointEnabled
nested_items.description: Enables an Apache Livy endpoint that you can connect to and run interactive jobs.

nested_items.name: schedulerConfiguration
nested_items.description: The scheduler configuration for batch and streaming jobs running on this application. Supported with release labels emr-7.0.0 and above.

nested_items.name: queueTimeoutMinutes
nested_items.description: The maximum duration in minutes for the job in QUEUED state. If scheduler configuration is enabled on your application, the default value is 360 minutes (6 hours). The valid range is from 15 to 720.

nested_items.name: maxConcurrentRuns
nested_items.description: The maximum concurrent job runs on this application. If scheduler configuration is enabled on your application, the default value is 15. The valid range is 1 to 1000.
